result.execSummary:
Bradley Allen Walz was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Bradley Allen Walz was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Allen Walz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SRN and Defendant signed this date. eif

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Sharon Correll,   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Bradley Allen Walz appeared from jail. ASL Interpreter Patty McCutcheon appears and sworn in. Defendant has a felony warrant out of Stearns County MN. Court informs def of charges from Minnesota. Def understands. Defendant waives extradition. Defendant sworn in.  SRN and Defendant sign waiver of extradition. Defendant to be held without bond pending pick up from Minnesota.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
